repnme.cdata!: Sudan - South Kordofan State Emergency Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the South Kordofan State
            Emergency Project for Sudan were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory; risk to development outcome was
            substantial; Bank performance was moderately satisfactory;
            grantee performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned includes: setting a counterpart share needs
            to be realistic for a country coming out of conflict. The 50
            percent counterpart share in Multi-Donor Trust Fund (MDTF),
            although agreed by the Government, was unprecedentedly high.
            This became evident when the Government defaulted on its
            commitments resulting in many implementation delays
            throughout the MDTF portfolio. Close interaction and
            engagement with local authorities is essential from the
            outset. The Bank should broaden its engagement beyond its
            official counterpart, the Ministry of Finance. Bank
            engagement with the state government once the project faced
            counterpart funding issues proved successful and suggests
            closer dialogue on a regular basis. A better risk assessment
            is required in fragile settings, but this must translate
            into more appropriate project design. It is not sufficient
            to provide a good assessment of risks, as was done in the
            project, but the risk assessment needs to inform project
            design. Resolving the tension and trade-offs between the
            need to act quickly to stabilize conflict affected
            populations and longer-term capacity development objectives.
            Where there is an inherent tension between the need to
            respond quickly, as in an emergency operation, and the need
            to build local capacity, project design needs to acknowledge
            this tension, the potential trade-offs and ways in which
            these can be resolved during project implementation. Better
            institutional arrangements and government involvement in
            overall project coordination when components are implemented
            by different agencies, especially if they are national and
            international. Even where there is a need to act quickly,
            there is a need to ensure some level of stakeholder
            involvement and consultations, which can be deepened as the
            project is implemented.

repnme.cdata!:
Sudan - South Kordofan State Emergency
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The South Kordofan State Emergency
            Project for Sudan has two key objectives: to contribute on
            the one hand to the supply of basic services and facilities
            to the respective conflict-affected populations; and to
            contribute to capacity building of the state government to
            enable it to more effectively execute its mandate,
            especially at the local (decentralized) level. The extension
            is necessary to allow the Ministry of Economy and Investment
            of South Kordofan (acting on behalf of the project
            implementing entity, the Government of South Kordofan) to
            utilize counterpart funds in the amount of US$4.5 million
            committed by the Government of South Kordofan and additional
            funding to be presented soon in the amount of US$14 million
            and to complete planned activities to achieve the original
            project objectives. Progress reported by the State
            Government suggests that project activities will be
            completed in accordance with the revised action plan. The
            task team closely assisted the project coordination unit in
            formulating this action plan, and is satisfied that the
            indicated activities and time-frame are feasible and will
            result in the achievement of the intended project objectives.
